did.unittitle: Tulancingo (Hildago, Mexico) Manuscript Collection
did.abstract: This collection consists of manuscript documents in Spanish and Nahuatl from the town of Tulancingo (Hidalgo, Mexico). The documents consist primarily of civil litigation case files, but also include a small amount of criminal case files and several government printed broadsides.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English, Spanish, and Nahuatl.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Tulancingo (Hildago, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (Collection Number 2073). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: This collection was initially processed by Manuscripts Division staff (date unknown) and was reprocessed in 2006 by Phillip Ramirez (June 2006) and Erika Perez (August 2006) with assistance from Laurel McPhee and Elizabeth Sheehan in the Center for Primary Research and Training.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: This collection of manuscripts was in the private collection of John H. Grepe of Dallas, Texas from approximately 1957 to 1975. In September 1975, Grepe sold the items as one collection to Gene Hanrahan, president of R & D Books of Salisbury, North Carolina. In August 1977, this same collection was sold via Libros Latinos of Los Angeles, California to the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). In August 1981, more Tulancingo manuscripts were acquired by UCLA from Howard Karno Books, Inc. and added to the collection.
This collection was formerly known as the John H. Grepe collection and A Collection of material about Tulancingo, Hidalgo, Mexico, 1540-1875.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists primarily of civil litigation case files from the district of Tulancingo, Mexico, dating from 1567-1882. The collection is interspersed with a few criminal case files and several government printed broadsides. Some case files also fall under the jurisdiction of Mexico City.

The boxes have been roughly divided according to the date of judgment or arbitration date; however, many files include subsequent notations entered by civil authorities as it related to outstanding matters towards fulfillment of the judgment.

Case files prior to 1837 are notable for revealing the maneuverings of indigenous communities within the legal system, the involvement of women in various business and property disputes, the colonial tribute system, tensions surrounding the War of Independence, and acts of resistance to the colonial regime by native peoples. Some of the more interesting case files include a property dispute involving Martín Cortés, the son of Hernán Cortés, the investigation of an Indian riot, and an Indian woman, who had been a traditional healer, being accused of witchcraft. Case files prior to 1837 contain some documents in Nahuatl.

Case files from 1846 to 1882 deal primarily with probate matters (often including estate inventories and wills), financial disputes between merchants and creditors, and demands for repayment of liens or mortgages. Researchers will find extensive documents with respect to four different actions: probate matters pertaining to the estate of Maria Josefa Ortega, a bankruptcy proceeding against Apolonio Uribarri, a civil dispute involving the Sanchez Hidalgo family, and the dissolution of a commercial partnership involving Spanish merchants Antonio Gayol and Tomas Urrutia. Scholars interested in researching issues of gender and sexuality will find several notable cases, for example, a case involving an older male resident who pursued relations with a younger girl and later denied paternity to their child; cases of mothers seeking legal recognition and assets from the fathers of illegitimate children; and cases involving allegations of physical abuse and infidelity. In addition to the aforementioned, scholars will find numerous examples of women's involvement in civil disputes over outstanding mortgages, as business owners, as estate executors and legal guardians for their children, and in property disputes. Case files from this period contain very little mention of Indian peoples and no Nahuatl documents.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Printed materials (.5 box)
Pre-1837 manuscripts (2.5 boxes)
Post-1852 manuscripts (5 boxes).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Byron McAfee papers, ca. 1553-1964 (Collection 339) . Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.
Eduard Seler papers, ca. 1884-1922 (Collection 1449) . Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.
Collection of material relating to Mexico, 1860-1930 (Collection 190) . Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.

altformavail.head: Online Items Available
altformavail.p: Portions of this collection have been digitized and are available online: Tulancingo (Hildalgo, Mexico) Manuscript Collection (14 items).

did.unittitle: Printed materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series consists of broadsides and printed religious material.

did.unittitle: Broadsides
Broadsides
Broadsides
Broadsides
Religious printed material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Bula de composicion para los Reynos de Indias."

did.unittitle: Pre-1837 manuscripts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series consists of civil and criminal litigation documents, including some in Nahuatl.

did.unittitle: [Compilation of petitions]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anachronistic compilation of petitions, sewn together. Most were presented to the alcalde mayor (chief magistrate), Don Pedro Ladron de Guevara. Documents primarily concern economic or material redress and reference the districts of Singuilucan, Acatlán.

did.unittitle: [Documents relating to the Sebastian Vazquez case, and others]
did.physdesc: 2 leaves and 1 bifolium : paper ; various sizes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Incomplete set of documents relating to the case of Sebastian Bazquez [Vazquez], who claimed ownership of indigenous land. Includes unrelated material, such as Nahuatl petitions. Text in both Nahuatl and Spanish.

did.unittitle: [Martín Cortés vs. Hernando de Paz]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to the suit of Don Martín Cortés, Marqués del Valle, versus Hernando de Paz over the estancia of Acatlán. Cover page indicates the documents contain the "probanzas y testimonios" of the case. Case file begins with the original decision.

did.unittitle: [Dowry of Catalina de Arellano]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Incomplete copy of the dowry of Doña Catalina de Arellano, in her marriage to Francisco de Terrazas, encomendero of Tulancingo (and Jaltepec?); no date given for transcription; Arellano received 22,000 gold pesos.

did.unittitle: [Pedro de Ontiveros vs. debtors]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to Pedro de Ontiveros' demand that indigenous men fully repay the 100 pesos he loaned them, of which he had only received half. Text mainly in Spanish and includes an admittance of debt (conocimiento) in Nahuatl, partially on one leaf.

did.unittitle: [Pedro Gonzales de Paredes vs. debtors]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Indigenous men promised to repay Pedro Gonzales de Paredes 17 fánegas of maize for a monetary loan; Paredes successfully litigated to force payment. Text in Nahuatl and Spanish.

did.unittitle: [Francisco de Terrazas vs. Diego Suares de Peredo]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Case documents relating to Francisco de Terrazas, encomendero of Tulancingo, who charged Diego de Suares de Peredo with the theft of six colts. Includes documents that do not relate directly to the case but do refer to Terrazas.

did.unittitle: [Juan Cuetlachcohuacatl vs. Marcos de Torres]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A dispute between Juan Cuetlachcohuacatl and Marcos de Torres, trustee for the estate of Don Diego Alexandrino, over the ownership of a piece of land. File includes witness testimonies. Text in Spanish, with one document in Nahuatl.

did.unittitle: [Notice of bail for Gabriel Bazquez and Don Juan Lorenço de San Francisco]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two indigenous officials, Don Gabriel Bazquez and Don Juan Lorenço de San Francisco were in jail for non- payment of tribute; they were later freed on bail (fianzas). Text in Nahuatl and Spanish.

did.unittitle: [Gomes Family land titles]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection of documents concerning the Gomes family landholdings. The majority of the leaves (19) are records of land sales in Nahuatl, the rest are in Spanish. (FF.20-1 are transcribed and translated in Lockhart 1991, pp. 97-101).

did.unittitle: [Estate of Pedro de la Mora and Doña Felipa de Arteaga]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Compilation of documents relating to the estate of Pedro de la Mora and Doña Felipa de Arteaga. Their daughter Doña Maria Ordoñez petitioned her uncle Andres de la Mora for the release of these papers so the possessions could be divided amongst the heirs

did.unittitle: [Bernardina Gutierrez vs. Domingo Hernandez]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents regarding a dispute between Bernardina Gutierrez and her son, Domingo Hernandez, over an hacienda which she had rented out to him. Gutierrez wants the hacienda back, and livestock and pesos owed. Text in Spanish with a testimony in Nahuatl and Spanish.

did.unittitle: [Juan Cordero vs. Francisco de Carrion]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A provision from the Real Audiencia in the case entitled Juan Cordero versus Francisco de Carrion involving the possession of 45 mules. With the official seal and signatures of the oidores.

did.unittitle: [Sale and transfer of titles for Indigenous land]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to the sale and transfer of ownership of land between four indigenous owners: Gaspar de Santiago, Diego de Mendosa, Juan de Ayala and Francisco Lario Gomez. Two leaves are in Nahuatl, one leaf in Spanish.

did.unittitle: [Diego Lopez de Escobar vs. Antonio de Mendoça]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provision from the Real Audiencia. Diego Lopez de Escobar was the guardian ad litem for the children of Juan Vibaldo [Bibaldo] de Mirabal and Ynes de Escobar, both deceased. The court ruled against Antonio de Mendoça.

did.unittitle: [Documents relating to the estate of Don Juan Manuel Basquez, and others]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Doña Josepha Catharina Franco, widow of Don Juan Manuel Basquez, initiated litigation to settle debts owed to her deceased husband. File includes a list of debtors, acknowledgements of debt, and documents relating to the landholdings of Luis Santos.

did.unittitle: [Francisco Ordoñez and Cathalina Dominguez vs. Miguel Caro]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provision from the Real Audiencia concerning the criminal case of Francisco Ordoñez and his wife Cathalina Dominguez versus Miguel Caro. Caro was found guilty of assaulting Cathalina; he was sentenced and paid his bail.

did.unittitle: [Juan de Olibares vs. Domingo Hernandes Yañes and Dyego Hortiz de Zanabria]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Domingo Hernandes Yañes and Dyego Hortiz de Zanabria were jailed in a dispute over the ownership and payment of mules with Juan de Olibares, a resident of Tlaxcala City. Dr. Luis Ximenez, professor of the Royal University, advised them.

did.unittitle: [Ana Gomes Montte Agudo vs. Juan Sanches de Montoya]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provision from the Real Audiencia. Ana Gomes Montte Agudo was in a dispute with Juan Sanches de Montoya, a local merchant, over her deceased husband's debt. With the official seal and signatures of the oidores.

did.unittitle: [Compilation of petitions, and Will of Ysabel Clara]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Varied and colorful collection of petitions presented to the alcalde mayor. Includes cases involving local merchants, a land dispute, a rape allegation, and the abduction of a wife. Issues concern both indigenous and Spanish residents.

did.unittitle: [Mill of Santiago]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Document concerning the mill of Santiago (Molino de Santiago) in Tulantepec.

did.unittitle: [Inventory of the estate of Phelipe de Baños]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Estate inventory indicating the monetary values of Baños' personal property, including houses on a hacienda named Guaxomulco. Prepared by Francisco de Medel, a local merchant.

did.unittitle: [Doña Sebastiana de Yslas vs. Manzano de Aguilera]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petition by Doña Sebastiana de Yslas demanding repyament of a loan borrowed by Pedro Manzano de Aguilera of San Miguel Huatengo.

did.unittitle: Declaracion en favor de Maria Augustina de la Cruz, de Temascatitla

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two copies of an original document in Nahuatl; one was transcribed from the original Nahuatl ca. 1722 - 1723; the other is a translation into Spanish made in 1777. The text contains an indigenous cabildo's confirmation about a plot of land.

did.unittitle: [Dispute regarding Hacienda of Ixtlahuacan]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to a dispute of ownership over a hacienda named Ysptlaguacan [Ixtlahuacan]. Property belonged to Francisco Lopez de Medina, and was inherited by his children, Cristobal Hernandes and Clara de Fonseca. Antonio de Espinosa, a resident o

did.unittitle: [Regulations concerning the celebration of Corpus Christi]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Don Blas Perez de las Casas (secretary of the Inquisition and alcalde mayor) mandated that residents attend the procession of the sacrament of Corpus Christi. He also imposed a fine of wax for those who do not attend.

did.unittitle: [Indigenous elections in Singuilucan]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Don Blas Perez de las Casas (secretary of the Inquisition and alcalde mayor) mandated that the indigenous residents of Singuilucan hold elections for posts in their local government. De las Casas proposed three candidates and rules for the election.

did.unittitle: [Maria Cortes de Arellanos vs. Francisco de la Cruz]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Francisco de la Cruz (indigenous) was accused of having pre-marital relations with Maria Cortes de Arellanos. Cruz was jailed and implicated another man, Juan Thomas Thelles. File contains the testimony of both Thelles and Arellanos.

did.unittitle: [Notice of visit from Don Blas Perez de las Casas]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Don Blas Perez de las Casas (secretary of the Inquisition and alcalde mayor) mandated that local leaders inform and prepare the indigenous people for his visit. He intended to register them, their wives, children and other relatives.

did.unittitle: [Power of representation granted to Don Joachin Doistua]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Doña Luganda Fernandez de la Quintana, of Real del Monte, grants power of representation to Don Joachin Doistua, domicile priest.

did.unittitle: [Notice about loose pigs]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Local indigenous people brought a complaint about the town's loose pigs, which were damaging their crops. All owners of such livestock were mandated to collect and tie them up.

did.unittitle: [Benito Fernandez vs. Carlos Joachin Marquez de Figueroa]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A provision from the Real Audiencia regarding litigation over a rancho. Dispute was between Don Benito Fernandez, custodian of Don Jose Lopez Lacaño, and Don Carlos Joachin Marquez de Figueroa, a local priest.

did.unittitle: [Decision in the case of Francisco Xauier de Medina y Aguirre and the chaplaincy of Don Ygnacio de Castro]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provision from the Real Audiencia. Don Francisco Xauier de Medina y Aguirre, administrator of the chaplaincy of Don Ygnacio de Castro, presented litigation to expedite the allocation of resources to establish the chaplaincy, as provided for in his will.

did.unittitle: [Juan Family litigation regarding the title for Texalpan, and Will of Don Francisco Larios]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The family of Don Christobal Juan, indigenous nobleman, lost an important family document, a bill of sale for a piece of land in Acatlán called Texalpan. He presented litigation to confirm his ownership of the property.

did.unittitle: [Doña Juana de Bargas Machuca vs. Santiago Joseph de Galicia]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to the dispute between the aged widow Doña Juana de Bargas Machuca and the indigenous man Don Santiago Joseph de Galicia. Dispute pertains to an apple orchard and includes witness testimonies. Text in Spanish, with one document in Nahuatl.

did.unittitle: [Don Pascual Monter vs. Andres Monter]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Don Pascual Monter and Doña Maria de Escamilla issued a formal complaint against Andres Monter alleging that he committed incest by taking their daughter's virginity (Maria Rita Monter), and stole some of her valuables. Includes the testimony of Maria Rita Monter.

did.unittitle: [Report on the production of saltpeter and gunpowder]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report-testimony by Don Francisco de Borja y Victoria of the Santa Hermandad concerning the manufacture of saltpeter and gunpowder, and what could be done to augment its production.

did.unittitle: [Indigenous governor of Atotonilco vs. the inheritors of Miguel Sanchez de Naua]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Indigenous governor of Atotonilco denounced the inheritors of Miguel Sanchez de Naua [Nava?] who took over indigenous community lands. The Real Audiencia condemned the illicit removal and restored the lands.

did.unittitle: [Will of Domingo de la Cruz, and Statement on the death of Domingo Rosales]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will of Domingo de la Cruz including text relating to the death of an indigenous man, Domingo Rosales. Will in Nahuatl, with other text in Spanish.

did.unittitle: [Litigation converning parochial rights]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to a priest's abuse of privileges with the local clergy. He allegedly took advantage of his powers to levy tariffs (arancel) and made the people do his personal work. Several complaints by the indigenous cabildo prompted this legal act.

did.unittitle: [Tribute payment relief]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Real Acuerdo in Mexico City response to a plea by the indigenous people of Acaxochitlán who petitioned for relief of tribute payment because of an epidemic which they were suffering.

did.unittitle: [Inventory of the estate of Doña Ysabel de Alfaro]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Partial inventory of the personal effects of Doña Ysabel de Alfaro, deceased. Page 92 is an assessment of her china and crystal ware which reveals material culture for this period. Page 93 lists and describes her religious images.

did.unittitle: [Broadside]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Broadside announcement. On recto: record of a land sale by Luis José Casares to his cousin; record ordering a new election for indigenous leadership positions, with a list of names (possibly candidates). Broadside text in Nahuatl; writing on recto in Spanish.

did.unittitle: [Complaint of María de Ortega]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formal complaint by María de Ortega against Manuel de Ybarra over a broken marriage promise. Ybarra had proposed to Ortega but after eight months they still had not married.

did.unittitle: [Don Manuel Monter vs. Don Jose Ygnacio Asiain]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents concerning Don Manuel Monter of Rancho de Tiltepec, el Chico. Monter sought to collect payment from various neighbors who were indebted to him. In particular, he brought litigation against Don Jose Ygnacio Asiain for the amount of $110 pesos.

did.unittitle: Ymbentario á los bienes q[u]e quedaron p[o]r fallecimiento del intestado D. Sebastian Farias vecino de este Pueblo
did.physdesc: 111 leaves and 1 bifolium : paper ; various sizes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as: "Inventory of the estate of Don Sebastián Farías, who died without a testament, and was a resident of this town." Farias died without a will, and the documents represent the lengthy settlement of his estate, including inventories.

did.unittitle: [Estate of Doña Maria Antonia de Órdaz]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents for the estate of Doña Maria Antonia de Órdaz, wife of Don Estevan Garcia. Don José Perez de Arroyo y Roxas de Sandoval was the accountant in charge of the inventory and distribution of the inheritance to her two children.

did.unittitle: [Litigation over water rights]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dispute over water rights in Atotonilco el Grande. Hacienda de la Venta, which belonged to the Conde de Santiago, claimed ownership of water supplies, and indigenous leaders protested. Includes testimony of Don Nicolas Montalvo.

did.unittitle: [Notice from the Viceroy regarding infantry deserters]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Broadside announcement: The Viceroy disapproved of dissention from the infantry regiments and mandated that deserters be punished severely.

did.unittitle: [Letters from Don Bernardo Bonavía]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A small collection of brief letters from Don Bernardo Bonavía, Intendant of Mexico, to the subdelegate of Tulancingo. Letters consist mostly of instructions and orders, often dealing with viceregal mandates.

did.unittitle: [Record of baptisms, marriages and burials]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Small fragment sheet which lists the number of baptisms, marriages and burials in Tulancingo and its dependencies. Verso has a comment about corn. Undated.

did.unittitle: [Census regulations]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A list of rules and regulations from Don Bernardo Bonavía for conducting the census (padron). There are 19 detailed paragraphs of instructions.

did.unittitle: [Letter to Don Bernardo Bonavía]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unsigned copy of a letter to Don Bernardo Bonavía, Intendant of Mexico, concerning the status of the census (padron).

did.unittitle: [Prohibition against playing games]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Broadside containing an edict (bando) from Don Juan José Ossorio Moctezuma, of the Real Audiencia: He forbade residents from playing hopscotch and ball games in public spaces. He stated that transgressors would be fined and punished.

did.unittitle: [Miscellaneous coversheets]
did.physdesc: 2 leaves and 1 bifolium : paper ; various sizes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Coversheets which have been separated from larger packets of documents.

did.unittitle: [Town reports]
did.physdesc: 4 leaves and 1 bifolium : paper ; 31 x 22 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports from the constituencies of the jurisdiction of Tulancingo. Each head town (cabecera) sent in a list of their own dependent pueblos, ranchos and haciendas.

did.unittitle: [Felipe Badillo's opposition to his son's marriage]
did.physdesc: 1 leaf and 1 bifolium : paper ; 31 x 22 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Felipe Badillo presented a petition protesting the marriage of his son Ygnacio Badillo with Anastacia Beliz. Badillo, the father, considered Beliz to be inferior to his family and was vehemently against their matrimony. He tried punishment to stop his son.

did.unittitle: [Report on the local post office]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report by Juan M. Arellanos, administrator of the local post office, to subdelegate Don Francisco Lardizaval. Arellanos described the inner workings of the organization, giving the names of the workers there and details on their various mail routes.

did.unittitle: [Report from Don Juan Ygnacio Assiayn [Asiain], Administrator of Tobacco]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report details the number of sheets of paper (pliegos), gunpowder, card decks and materials for cigar-making used in 1773.

did.unittitle: [Report on bovine consumption]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report on the number of cows consumed in Tulancingo and its dependencies in 1793. The total was 705.

did.unittitle: [List of reports]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of reports stating which administrators would report on what items. Referenced the reports of Asiain and Arellanos (cf. box 2, f.27 & f.26 respectively).

did.unittitle: [Statement on the destruction of tobacco plants]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to the destruction of tobacco plants grown in the mountains of Tulancingo and Huauchinango, ordered by the Real Hacienda by inspector Don Domingo Sanz. Includes a lengthy list naming indigenous men caught with sown tobacco fields.

did.unittitle: [Indigenous leaders of Atotonilco vs. Don Miguel Larralde]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Indigenous leaders of Atotonilco denounced the local justice administrator (encargado de la administracion de justicia), Don Miguel Larralde, for his unjust oppression. They were represented by Don Francisco Rubin de Celis. Documents reveal accusations.

did.unittitle: [Complaint of Doña Maria Gertrudis Ruis]
did.physdesc: 1 leaf and 1 bifolium : paper ; 31 x 21 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Doña Maria Gertrudis Ruis, widow of Don Antonio Guerrero, initiated a complaint against José Maria Marques. Marques had been trying to marry Ruis's daughter, Maria Manuela Guerrero. Ruis felt that they were not equal.

did.unittitle: [Deposition of Anselmo Rodriguez Baldo]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anselmo Rodriguez Baldo presented testimony against Don Antonio Duran and Duran's mother Doña Antonia Perez. Rodriguez was a cleric and owner of Hacienda de Totuapa el Grande. He protested Duran's attempt to create a new mill. Document is a copy, signed.

did.unittitle: [Agustin Felipe de la Cruz and José Antonio de la Cruz vs. Hacienda de San Pedro de las Baquerias]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Action involving Agustin Felipe de la Cruz and José Antonio de la Cruz, indigenous, who worked on the Hacienda de San Pedro de las Baquerias [San Pedro Vaquerías] since childhood. They felt that they had been denied their full salary and were mistreated.

did.unittitle: [Copies of letters]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transcriptions of about eleven letters. Includes information on the search for fugitive Frenchmen, the Mill of Santiago, local area tribute payments, the contraband of pulque and other prohibited drinks, and others.

did.unittitle: [Report to the Viceroy on unemployment]
did.physdesc: 2 leaves and 2 bifolia : paper ; various sizes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Viceroy Branciforte requested a report on the residents of the jurisdiction, to determine unemployed (vago)indigenous, mulattos or blacks in the area. Documents include responses from local leaders, and a letter of reply to him from Jose Ximenes del Rio.

did.unittitle: [Letter about a donation from Tulancingo]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rought draft letter to Viceroy Brancifort indicating residents of the jurisdiction of Tulancinco had made a monetary donation of $1673 (plus 100 more from the author) pesos.

did.unittitle: [Request for church documents from the Real Tribunal]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of a letter by José Ximenez del Rio to the Viceroy, asking for the return of documents (expediente). They were sent to the Real Tribunal and concerned the local church in Tulancingo.

did.unittitle: [Documents concerning the formation of local military companies]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In accordance with the Viceroy's orders, three militia companies (compañias sueltas de milicias) were formed. They each consisted of 120 local men and were made up of a mixed ethnic group (Spaniards, Mestizos, and Castizos).

did.unittitle: [Regulations on selling food in the market]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Various vendors have been caught selling fruits, seeds, chiles, etc. at the market at deflated prices (regatonería). Four provisions were enacted to regulate their business.

did.unittitle: [Letters from L. M. de Perea]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of two letters by L. M. de Perea (?). One discusses the harvesting of cotton and chile which was sold in the market. The other asked Don Cadena to deliver a certification to the judge of the general court.

did.unittitle: Sup[eri]or or[de]n p[ar]a q[u]e los Ec[lesiasti]cos no exersan la Abogacia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as: "Superior order so that ecclesiastics do not practice law." A letter from the Viceroy Branciforte mandated that clerics were not to practice law. Don Manuel de Perea, lawyer of the Real Audiencia, sent the notice out locally.

did.unittitle: [Military inscription records]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two separate inscription records for Mathias Gomez and José Bisente Morgado. The documents describe their physical features in detail and bound them to a twelve-year service contract with the military.

did.unittitle: [Letters concerning enlisters]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of three letters concerning military recruits: Gregorio Antonio Perez, Joseph Miguel Lopez (of Atotonilco), and Ysidro Lascano (of Tantoyuca?).

did.unittitle: [Miscellaneous correspondence]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two letters: One from Miguel Nazianzono Lopez to Don José Ximenes del Rio, and another (impartial copy) from Don Pedro Garibay.

did.unittitle: [Don José Ximenes del Rio's report on the women's jail]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The subdelegate of Tulancingo, Don José Ximenes del Rio, decided to close the women's jail and relocate them to a special house. The document reveals what he considered to be the problems associated with these women.

did.unittitle: [Copies of unsigned letters]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of four letters by an unsigned author. They concern: an acknowledgement of the alliance between Spain and France, a verification that no foreigners had entered the area, recognition of orders to capture Don Juan Ramon y Duran.

did.unittitle: Ynformacion recivida apedimento de la parte del Cura del Pueblo de Tututepeque Contra Juan Tolentino y socios sobre varios exesos

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as "Information received at the request of the priest of Tutotepec against Juan Tolentino and his associates for their various excesses." Juan Tolentino, his son Nicolas Tolentino, and his brother Juan de San Agustin (all Spanish- speaking).

did.unittitle: [Brigada Gertrudis Santos vs. Gregoria the widow]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brigada Gertrudis Santos complained to local authorities about Gregoria, the widow, who was having an illicit affair with Santos's husband, Antonio de San Juan (indigenous). The document reveals problems that existed between these two women.

did.unittitle: [Documents concerning the Otomí of Huehuetla and the Tepehua of Tenango]
did.physdesc: 2 leaves and 3 bifolia : paper ; various sizes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence documenting the conflict between the Otomí of Huehuetla and the Tepehua of Tenango. The Otomí had two requests: the right to elect a governor and a priest to teach them Christian dogma.

did.unittitle: [Copies of miscellaneous letters]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of nine letters, concerning various topics.

did.unittitle: [Receipt of compendium]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of a brief letter, which mentions having received the compendium on the method of mulberry tree raising.

did.unittitle: Diligencias practicadas en virtud del Escrito que las principia sobre el Tumulto formado en el Pueblo de Tututepeque entre los Naturales del mismo Pueblo como adentro se expresa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as "Proceedings concerning the tumult in Tutotepec among the Indigenous who live there, as expressed within." The Tolentinos and others were accused of instigating a riot (cf. box 3, f.1). A drunk man was accused of cursing at a priest.

did.unittitle: [Letter about the coming of the Viceroy]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of an unsigned letter. The author received notice that the Viceroy would stay in the town so he could learn about the army troops which were there because of the war with Great Britain.

did.unittitle: [Letter to Don Jose Ximenez del Rio from Calado]
[Letter to Don Gaspar Martin]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unsigned letter to vicar Don Gaspar Martin. The author won $2000 pesos in the lottery. He informed vicar Martin of how the money would be used and related other news.

did.unittitle: [Accusations of witchcraft]
did.physdesc: 7 leaves and 1 bifolium : paper ; 31 x 22 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Josefa Manuela, an indigenous woman from Tenango who appeared to have been a traditional healer, was accused of witchcraft by Josefa Estefania and Mariana Pascuala. The priest Don Juan Anselmo Rodriguez Pizarro placed Josefa Manuela in jail for three months.

did.unittitle: [Casiano Martinez vs. Maria Josefa Perez]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dispute between Casiano Martinez and Maria Josefa Perez. Casiano Martinez claims defendant Perez has a well-venerated painting (lienzo) of San Antonio del Jacalito which belonged to his family. He demanded its return and other items.

did.unittitle: Expediente promovido p[o]r Pioquinto Campozano sobre q[u]e se verifique el matrimonio que tiene tratado con D[oñ]a Dolores Araujo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as "Proceedings instigated by Pioquinto Campozano concerning the verification of his engagement to Doña Dolores Araujo." Pioquinto Campozano [Canposano] was engaged to Doña Maria Dolores Araujo, but he could not marry her.

did.unittitle: [Charges of prostitution]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Juan Agaton Luvian was accused of prostituting María Meriotegui (his cousin), on the Temascalillos ranch. File includes testimony of Luvian, the family's problems, and the reason for what happened.

did.unittitle: [Indigenous petition from Santa Ana Hueytlalpan]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Indigenous governors of Santa Ana Hueytlalpan petitioned to denounce the exploitation they suffered from the head-town (cabecera), particularly from Don Marcelo Santuario and Don Mateo Milpas. They listed their tribute obligations.

did.unittitle: [Mine claim of Anastacio Antonio Rios]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anastacio Antonio Rios found a metal deposit in the mountains and issued a formal claim to the Pachuca authorities. The authorities ask the subdelegate (subdelegado) of Tulancingo to place notices (rotulones) in public places for three consecutive Sundays.

did.unittitle: [Luis Coronado vs. José Mariano Asiain]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provision from the Real Audiencia. Don José Mariano Asiain of Atotonilco was in a dispute with Don Luis Coronado over a purchase price (of bulls?). With signatures of the oidores (without the official seal).

did.unittitle: Cabildo hecho en Huasca para alarmarlo en defensa de la Justa causa contra los Ynsurgentes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as "Meeting held in Huasca in preparation of the just cause of defense against the insurgents." Documents related to the defense of Huasca de Ocampo from the insurgents of the War for Independence.

did.unittitle: [Plans for the defense of Tulancingo against insurgents]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Document noting the progress and reaction to the independence movement, and the promotion of defense plans for the area from insurgents. Signed by Don Jose Sandoval.

did.unittitle: [Complaint against Ignacio Adalid, tavern owner]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Complaint brought against pulque tavern owner in Acatlán named Don Ignacio Adalid where people "commit many excesses and speak with liberty in favor of the insurrection."

did.unittitle: [Inventory of the estate of Don Pedro Escorra]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Estate inventory compiled by Juan Martinez de Oropesa at the request of Doña Maria Guadalupe Hernandez, widow of Don Pedro Escorra. Document lists the lands that Escorra owned, their values, his debts and bequeaths a statue of Christ [El Señor Crucificad]

did.unittitle: [Don Ysidro and Don Nicolas Jusue vs. Jose Francisco Perez]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Don Ysidro and Don Nicolas Jusue, brothers in Spain, sought to collect a debt from Don Jose Francisco Perez of Atotonilco, el Grande. The documents illustrate the long litigation process, which spanned the colonial, imperial, and independent eras.

did.unittitle: [Criminal case against Crisanto de la Cruz and Maria Jacinta]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Provision from the Real Audiencia. Crisanto de la Cruz and his wife Maria Jacinta were accused of murdering José Eugenio, husband of Ana Rosalia. Contains oofficial seal and signatures of the oidores.

did.unittitle: [Law in preparation for the celebration of the Virgin Mary]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The mayor Don Jose Francisco Perez declared it illegal for people to consume pulque or snacks in the vicinity of the altars of Mary, as to avoid drunkenness and trivialities. Violators were to be fined 2 pesos.

did.unittitle: [Public announcement]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Broadside announcement prohibiting more than three men on horseback to be out after nine at night.

did.unittitle: [Letter from Francisco Abendaño]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter from Francisco Abendaño to Don Pedro de Torres y Miranda in Tulancingo concerning cattle ranching and taking the herd through various places (like Chalma and Calnali), and the difficulties he faced.

did.unittitle: [Military draft]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Local officials conducted a military draft of sixty men from the community. Documents describes how the draft was carried out and lists the names of all the men who were inscribed.

did.unittitle: [Legal defense argument for Jacinto Ramirez]
did.physdesc: 1 leaf and 1 bifolium : paper ; 32 x 22 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Jacinto Ramirez was jailed for military desertion. His lawyer Jose Zeferino de Melo presented a lengthy argument to set Ramirez free which revealed his ideas about liberty and civil rights in the fledgling nation.

did.unittitle: Sobre cobrar á los renuentes el prestamo forsoso de que habla la ley 30 de Junio de 1832

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as "Concerning forced payment on delinquent loans, which the law of June 30, 1832 allows for." The government of Tulancingo was applying the law of June 30, 1832, which allowed for forced payment collection on delinquent loans.

did.unittitle: Esped[ien]te promovido por parte del Jusgado de Testam[en]tos, Capellanias y Obras pias de este Arzobispado, en solicitud de que se le entre en la posesion hereditaria de los bienes que quedaron, por fallecimiento de D[oñ]a Rita Ramires

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates as "Proceedings instigated, by the Juzgado de Testamentos, Capellanías y Obras Pías of this archbishopric, to gain hereditary possession of the estate which remained after the death of Doña Rita Ramírez."

did.unittitle: [Request by Don Agustin Paredes Arrillaga]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Don Agustin Paredes Arrillaga, representing Don Agustin Suares de Peredo, requested the mortgage books (libros de hipoteca) for Hacienda de la Bolsa (?) to be registered.

did.unittitle: Post-1852 manuscripts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series consists of civil and criminal litigation documents.

did.unittitle: Año de 1854; ...de oficios

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents pertaining to the estates of Doña Joséfa de Sobrales, Doña Mariana de Yslas, Don Manuel Pérez y Morales and others.

did.unittitle: Decreto del Gob[ier]no G[ene]ral disponiendo el modo de...tirar la deuda interior, 1857

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unsigned draft outlining various issues and proposals concerning the interior debt.

did.unittitle: Acta del juicio verbal promovido sobre pesos por el Ciudadano Manuel Fernández contra D[oñ]a Jesús Hurtado

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit involving a financial dispute between Manuel Fernández and Doña Jesús Hurtado. Folder includes an authorization of attorney signed by Doña Jesús Hurtado allowing Don José María LÓpez to represent her in the lawsuit.

did.unittitle: [Settlement of the estate of Bernabé Madariaga]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents pertaining to the estate of Bernabé Madariaga.

did.unittitle: [Mixto de Civil y Criminal]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Criminal case involving Don Dimas LÓpez who was accused by Don Miguel Lastire of robbery at a ranch in Ayotla.

did.unittitle: Peticiones que el que suscribe articula a Don Nestor GarzÓn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petitions and correspondence regarding a legal matter involving Don Nestor GarzÓn, a Spaniard.

did.unittitle: El Lic. D. José M[arí]a Carvajal como apoderado de D[on]a Ana Ramos Amador contra D[on] Antonio Amador sobre administraciÓn de bienes y rendiciÓn de cuentas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probate documents for the estate of Don Juan Amador. Doña Ana Ramos Amador was named executor of her husband's estate and guardian for their child, María Rafaela. Issues arose between Ana Ramos Amador and Antonio Amador concerning the distribution of as[sets].

did.unittitle: Juicio de inventarios por memorias simples de la Testam[iento] a de Don Longinos Escorcia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probate documents for the estate of Don Longinos Escorcia. File includes a judgment concerning the estate inventory and a petition by Rafael Cortés, guardian for decedent's minor children Erlinda, Manuel, Julian, Dolores, and Adolfo Escorcia.

did.unittitle: Autos del intestado de Doña Margarita Vera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Legal documents pertaining to the intestacy of Doña Margarita Vera.

did.unittitle: [Antonio Martínez vs. heirs of Bernabé Madariaga]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Legal documents that include an accounting of the estate's assets and debts.

did.unittitle: Interdicto retinendi - promovido por lo veino del rancho de la Concepcion [Buenavista] contra Don Ygnacio Gonzales dueno del rancho del Ventorrillo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Legal documents and petitions relating to a dispute between Rafael Martinez and Don Yganico Gonzales, owner of the Ventorrillo ranch.

did.unittitle: Judicio ordinario sobre pesos El C. Manuel Palacios contra el de igual clase Antonio Guzman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit over money entitled Manuel Palacios versus Antonio Guzman. Documents include an accounting of debts owed by Don Antonio Guzman.

did.unittitle: Promovido por Don Ygnacio Moreno Ordoñez en representacion de Doña María de los Angeles y de Don Simon Porfirio Valenzuela, deduciendo derecho a los bienes del intestado de Don Agustin Valenzuela

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probate documents for the intestacy of Don Agustin Valenzuela include an estate inventory. Documents reflect that Doña María de los Angeles bore a child by Don Agustin Valenzuela, who was legally married to Doña Joséfa Ochoa.

did.unittitle: Memoria testamentaría de la S[eno]ra D[on]a ... Micaela Montez en tres fojas útiles del sello tercero del vienio de mil ochocientos sesenta y ocho y mil ochocientos sesenta y nueve Febrero ocho de mil ochocientos sesenta y ocho

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will and testament of Doña Micaela Montez.

did.unittitle: Autos del intestado de Darío Cubas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Legal documents pertaining to the intestacy of Dario Cubas.

did.unittitle: Ejecutivo sobre pesos promovido por D[on] Pedro María Soto, contra D[on] Ygnacio Urquijo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit over money initiated by Don Pedro María Soto against Don Ygnacio Urquijo.

did.unittitle: Juicio civil ordinario sobre pesos, promovido por D[on] José Victor Garzon contra D[on] Manuel Rodriguez Madariaga

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit over money entitled Don José Victor Garzon versus Don Manuel Rodriguez Madariaga.

did.unittitle: Acta del juicio verbal promovido por el Ciudadano Manuel Fellez contra el de igual clase Antonio Guzman, sobre pesos

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Verbal judgment in furtherance of resident Manuel Fellez's claim against Antonio Guzmán, an individual of the same class, regarding money.

did.unittitle: Juicio ejecutivo sobre pesos, promovido p[o]r el [Señor] Jesus Escorcia conta el de igual clase Antonio Pérez Arroyo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Executive judgment in a financial dispute in the entitled action Señor Jesus Escorcia versus Antonio Pérez Arroyo.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal sobre pesos promovido por el Ciud. Agustin Cosio contra el de igual clase Vic[en]te Ramir[e]z

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Verbal judgment in a financial dispute in the entitled action Agustin Cosio versus Vicente Ramirez. File includes the petition and letter for receipt of payment pursuant to the judgment found in favor of Agustín Cosio.

did.unittitle: El Ciudadano Trinidad Cásares solicitando se le dé testimonio de unos exhÓrlos relativos á la posecion que se diÓ de la hacienda de Tecanecapa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit in a property dispute involving a ranch in Tecanecapa.

did.unittitle: José Antonio Martinez promovido juicio de divorcio a su esposa D[oñ]a Emilia Barredo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Judgment for divorce involving José Antonio Martinez and Doña Emilia Barredo. Petition and legal documents reveal that the couple had four children during their fourteen years of marriage and that Don Martinez alleged that his wife had an affair.

did.unittitle: [Petitions and legal documents pertaining to the estate of Don José Flor and the executorship of Don Luís Pasos Nieto]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probate documents pertaining to the estate of Don José Flor and the administration of the estate by Don Luís Pasos Nieto. Documents indicate decedent left behind a widow, Doña Gertrudis Soto, and heirs Macario, Dolores, María de Jesus, and María Ysabel.

did.unittitle: Promobido por D[on] Luís Pasos Nieto renunciando el albaceasgo de la testamentaría de D[on] José Flor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inventory of debts and expenditures pertaining to the estate of Don José Flor submitted by Don Luís Pasos Nieto, executor. Various petitions and legal documents pertaining to the administration of the estate, including one by Macario Flor, son of decedent.

did.unittitle: [Petitions and legal documents concerning a debt owed by Don José Haro to Don Juan Olavarrieta, a merchant, for a mortgage on an iron foundry]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petitions and legal documents concerning a debt owed by Don José Haro to Don Juan Olavarrieta, a merchant, for a mortgage on an iron foundry.

did.unittitle: [Will and testament of Doña María Ygnacia Alarcon de Olvera]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will and testament of Doña Maria Ygnacia Alarcon de Olvera which lists Don Antonio Olvera executor of the estate and includes an itemized inventory of assets to be distributed among the following heirs: José María, María de la Soledad, María Rafaela.

did.unittitle: Juicio ejecutivo promovido sobre pesos por el Ciudadano Rafaél Yslas contra el de igual da se Rafaél Várgas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Executive judgment in a financial dispute involving Rafael Yslas and Rafael Várgas y Muños. Documents indicate a dispute over an outstanding lien for a house in Metepec. Folder also contains the related arbitration file.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal sobre pesos: D[on] José Vicente Moreno contra la S[eño]ra D[oñ]a Petra Oliva de Moreno

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petition and judgment ordering Doña Petra Oliva de Moreno to pay Don José Vicente Morena three hundred pesos and court costs. A related issue is a loan which Doña Petra Oliva de Moreno had arranged from Don Antonio Gayol.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal sobre pesos promovido por Doñ[a] Trinidad Campos contra Don Nestor Garzon, Concluído.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Judgment in a financial dispute in the entitled action Doña Trinidad Campos versus Don Nestor Garzon. Petition was initially pursued by Don Agapito Campos who died and the case was taken up by his widow.

did.unittitle: Cuaderno que comprende la competencia de jurisdiccion iniciada por el C. Juez 2o [Segundo] de 1a [primera] instancia de la Capital de México para conocer en el juicio ejecutivo que sobre pesos sigue en este juzgado el C. Manuel Gonzales Barona

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Evidence in support of an executive judgment in a financial dispute in the entitled action Manuel Gonzales Barona versus Luís Barragan. At issue is the lack of compliance with a monetary judgment found in favor of Manuel Gonzales Barona against Luís Barragan.

did.unittitle: Juicio de hacienda publica sobre introduccion fraudulenta de los barriles de aguardiente

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Judgment regarding the seizure of illegal barrels of brandy found at the business of José María Lopez and Juan Vinay. Lopez confessed to running liquor at his house without proper permits. Lopez also implicated Martin Gallegos.

did.unittitle: Nombramiento de curador hecho por los menores Manuel y María Antonia Guerrero en favor de D[on] Manuel Marquez Oviedo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents in support of the naming of Don Manuel Marquez Oviedo as guardian for the minor children of decedent José María Guerrero: Manuel and María Antonia Guerrero, ages fourteen and twelve respectively.

did.unittitle: Autos de la testamentaría de D[on] Patricio Martinez de Oropeza

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probate documents pertaining to the estate of Don Patricio Martinez de Oropeza. Will and testament reveals Doña Antonia García de Oropeza, widow, and the couple's children José Cornelio, Demetrio Dario, and Angel Francisco Oropeza as heirs.

did.unittitle: [Dispute over a drawn draft between Don Juan Rueda, Don Ramon Rueda y Tijera and Don Antonio Gayol]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents pertaining to a disputed account draft by Juan Rueda containing an endorsement which read: "Paid to the order of the [Got?] Society and the Santiago Mill Company in the value of one thousand, eight-hundred and seventy."

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal sobre p[eso]s, El abogado representante de D[o]n Enrique Pontal contra D[o]n Antonio Gayol

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Folder includes petitions, correspondence, and other legal documents in a civil suit initiated by Enrique Pontal against Antonio Gayol, a Spanish subject, over a disputed lien. Don Antonio Gayol protested the allegation that he owed payments to Don Enrique

did.unittitle: Acta de tranzacion entre los herederos de la testamentaría de J[uan] Ant[oni]o Gonzalez

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Probate documents including the last will and testament for Juan Antonio Gonzalez. Petition requests payment of estate expenditures with the remainder to be divided by the following adult heirs: María Dolores Gonzales, Yldefonso Gregorio

did.unittitle: Ejecutivo sobre p[eso]s promovido por D[on] Ygnacio Moreno Leon contra D[on] Manuel Gonzalez Madrid, Concluído

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petiton and legal documents pertaining to a final judgment in a dispute over a rental agreement in the entitled action Don Ygnacio Moreno Leon versus Don Manuel Gonzalez Madrid. File contains a rental agreement for the property Hacienda de San José.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal sobre pago de honorarios promovido por el C. D[octo]r Manuel Limon contra el C. Juan García

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petition by Dr. Manuel LimÓn against Don Juan García for fees and expenses relating to an operation performed by Dr. LimÓn for Don García's daughter.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal sobre pesos, D[on] Gabino Gonzales contra D[oñ]a Dolores Sebilla

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit over money in the entitled action Don Gabino Gonzales versus Doña Dolores Sevilla over payments owed by Doña Sevilla. File includes a petition by Don Gabino Gonzales against Doña Dolores Sevilla for interest and legal costs.

did.unittitle: Autos de la tercería de preferencia interpuesta por D[on] Rafael Cortez en el juicio ejecutivo que sigue D[on] Tomas Urrutia contra D[on] Mariano Molina sobre p[eso]s

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arbitration documents for preference interposed by Don Rafael Cortez in the executive judgment which follows in Don Tomas Urrutia versus Don Mariano Molina, over money.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal sobre pesos, El representante del C. Mariano Martinez contra el Síndico del H. Ayuntamiento de esta Municipalidad

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Verbal judgment in a financial dispute between Mariano Martinez versus the trustee for the city council of Santa María.

did.unittitle: Ejecutivo sobre pesos promovido por Doña María Luz Arriola contra el S[eñor] Felipe Gomez

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit initiated by Doña María Luz Arriola versus Señor Felipe Gomez for debts owed.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal promovido sobre pesos por D[on] Manuel Fellez contra D[on] Antonio Várgas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Verbal judgment in a financial dispute in Don Manuel Fellez versus Don Antonio Várgas.

did.unittitle: Diligencias practicadas á solicitud del súbdito Aleman José Senecal pidiendo la entrega de una fábrica de cerveza que prestÓ á Luís Sedra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petition in a civil suit initiated by German subject, José Senecal, demanding the return of beer brewing materials which were found in the possession of Luís Sedra, also a German subject.

did.unittitle: Juicio ejecutivo promovido sobre pesos por el S[eñ]or Lic. D[on] José María Carvajal contra D[on] Pedro Montes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Executive judgment awarding money in the entitled action Manuel Gonzalez Barona versus Pedro Montes.

did.unittitle: Testimonio de las diligencias practicadas en la tercería de dominio que promoviÓ la Señora D[oñ]a Petra Oliva de Moreno en el juicio que sobre pesos intentÓ en su contra Don José Vicente Moreno

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Testimony of diligence by Señora Doña Petra Oliva de Moreno in a civil arbitration for a financial dispute against Don José Vicente Moreno. File includes petitions, witness information, and interrogatory responses.

did.unittitle: Juicio verbal Adolfo Rosin contra José Soledad Aycardo sobre pesos, Concluído

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Verbal judgment in a civil suit by Adolfo Rosin, an American citizen, versus José Soledad Aycardo. File includes an accounting of debts owed by José Soledad Aycardo and the judgment appears to have been satisfied.

did.unittitle: Testimonio del poder especial otorgada por el C. Juan Huazo, a fabor del C. Lic. Francisco Rodriguez Madariaga

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit in a financial dispute entitled Juan Huaza, a merchant, versus Ygnacio Urquijo. Juan Huaza, represented by Francisco Rodriguez Madariaga, alleged that Ygnacio Urquijo failed to fulfill the terms of a sales agreement. File includes petitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit over money by Vicente Hernandez versus Jorge Alarcon. Jorge Alarcon had borrowed $660 pesos from Vicente Hernandez and Hernandez sued to recover the loan. File includes the original letter signed by Alarcon memorializing the loan.

did.unittitle: [Documents relating to the marriage separation between Felipe Saldivar and María Faustina Lira of the town of San Lorenzo]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents indicate that María Faustina Lira initiated legal proceedings against her husband Felipe Saldivar due to mistreatment and discord during their marriage. Petition indicates that María Faustina Lira ended up in the hospital and her husband in jail.

did.unittitle: Ynterdicto de depojo promovido por el C. Luís Rodriguez contra el C. José M[ari]a Olvera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Civil suit involving a property dispute and a violent confrontation alleged by Luís Rodriguez against José María Olvera. In his petition, Luís Rodriguez alleges that the defendant stripped him of his land with the aid of a gang of peons.

did.unittitle: Sobre nombramiento de tutor a los hijos del finado C. Vicente Pérez
